author: Jon Ferguson, VP of silicon engineering, Axelera AI
description:
For decades, semiconductor development has operated on a consistent, 24- to 36-month design development cycle. While this model worked well when compute requirements were less demanding and innovation moved at a more manageable pace, AI has created a new set of rules. The breakneck speed of AI development is quickly exceeding the capabilities of current-generation […]

The post How Chip Startups Are Changing the Way Chips Are Designed appeared first on EE Times.
title: How Chip Startups Are Changing the Way Chips Are Designed

author: Hynetek Semiconductor Co., Ltd.
description:
With increasing demand for high-power fast charging in electronic devices, the USB Power Delivery (USB PD) protocol has become the most widely employed charging protocol for modern smart devices. Thanks to mechanisms such as Programmable Power Supply (PPS) and configurable voltage/power output, the USB PD 3.1 specification already supports up to 240 W of power […]

The post Power your devices through universal USB-C 48 V rail, Hynetek brings new USB PD3.2 DRP Controller appeared first on EE Times.
title: Power your devices through universal USB-C 48 V rail, Hynetek brings new USB PD3.2 DRP Controller

author: Yashasvini Razdan
description:
Kaynes Semicon is establishing an R&D Center in Gujarat for Power Semiconductor packaging following the Fujitsu infrastructure acquisition.

The post India’s Kaynes Semicon Fast-Tracks Power Packaging Ambitions appeared first on EE Times.
title: India’s Kaynes Semicon Fast-Tracks Power Packaging Ambitions
